videos.title: 'The Women are Up to Something' — A Conversation with Professor Benjamin Lipscomb
videos.description:
In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler speaks with Dr. Benjamin Lipscomb, professor of philosophy at Houghton University, about his book "The Women are Up to Something." It tells the story of Elizabeth Anscombe, Philippa Foot, Mary Midgley, and Iris Murdoch, four women who revolutionized ethics in the 20th century.

videos.title: The End of Citizenship and Our Current Cultural Crisis — A Conversation with Victor Davis Hanson
videos.description: In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler speaks with Victor Davis Hanson, the Martin and Illie Anderson Senior Fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University. Professor Hanson's scholarship has earned him numerous awards including the National Humanities Medal and the Bradley Prize. His latest book, "The Dying Citizen," explores the history and importance of citizenship and the many threats it currently faces by our culture. It is the topic of th
videos.full_description:
In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler speaks with Victor Davis Hanson, the Martin and Illie Anderson Senior Fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University. Professor Hanson's scholarship has earned him numerous awards including the National Humanities Medal and the Bradley Prize. His latest book, "The Dying Citizen," explores the history and importance of citizenship and the many threats it currently faces by our culture. It is the topic of this "Thinking in Public" episode.

You can watch more editions of Thinking in Public here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYDFccf13ud8fp1cb7QW5La3esWMr663L

videos.title: America’s Last King?  King George III Reconsidered — A Conversation with Andrew Roberts
videos.description: In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler speaks with Andrew Roberts, the Roger and Martha Visiting Fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, as well as a Visiting Professor at the War Studies Department at King's College in London. He is one of the most consequential biographers in the English-speaking world today. His most recent biography, The Last King of America: The Misunderstood Reign of George III, reconsiders the life and reign of A
videos.full_description:
In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler speaks with Andrew Roberts, the Roger and Martha Visiting Fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, as well as a Visiting Professor at the War Studies Department at King's College in London. He is one of the most consequential biographers in the English-speaking world today. His most recent biography, The Last King of America: The Misunderstood Reign of George III, reconsiders the life and reign of America's last king, King George III and is the topic of this "Thinking in Public" episode.

You can watch more editions of Thinking in Public here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYDFccf13ud8fp1cb7QW5La3esWMr663L

videos.title: Theologian, Pastor, Reformer, Soldier? Ulrich Zwingli Reconsidered–A Conversation with Bruce Gordon
videos.description:
In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler speaks with Bruce Gordon, the Titus Street Professor of Ecclesiastical History at Yale Divinity School about his most recent book, "Zwingli: God's Armed Prophet." This important work surveys the fascinating life and legacy of Swiss Reformer Ulrich Zwingli and his influence on the Protestant Reformation.

videos.title: Leadership Forged in War: A Conversation With Historian Andrew Roberts
videos.description:
In this edition of the popular podcast series "Thinking in Public," Albert Mohler talks with award-winning historian Andrew Roberts about his newest book, "Leadership in War: Essential Lessons from Those Who Made History." This conversation covers notable leaders from history including: Napoleon Bonaparte, Horatio Nelson, Winston Churchill, Adolf Hitler, Joseph Stalin, George C. Marshall, Charles de Gaulle, Dwight D. Eisenhower, and Margaret Thatcher.
